name: Novotel Marne La Vallee Collegien

reviews.text: We prefer to stay with novotel for family trips as they are consistent and familiar, and also we always feel welcome with young kids. This novotel is very much in this theme, mostly families visiting disneyland over the holidays, the usual efficient service, though perhaps not as warm and on the ball as at others we have used. It works very well as a Disney stay, once you have oriented yourself with the roads, the drive is only fifteen mins and very easy, and parking at Disney village easy and pretty good value at ten euros for the day (park at the Vinci Disney Village not the main Park parking which is more expensive and seems to be further away). I'd bet it may in fact be quicker and less stressful than squeezing onto shuttle buses from the main Disney hotels or Val d'Europe ones. But it's not pretty itself, and the area is pure business park, so you must have a car. Dinner is nice but expensive, might be worth trying the pizza place or buffalo grill just next door, if not eating at disneyland.
reviews.title: Good value Disney stay

reviews.text: We stayed here 4 years ago and it seems to have gotten worse in that time, the furniture dated, filthy room and bathroom, paint all over the light switches. Our shower didnt work and when I asked for it to be fixed we were told that it couldnt be however we could change rooms - funny how they had said it was fully booked a few hours earlier? It went from boiling to freezing constantly and so was un usable. Also when you filled the sink with water and let it out, the water came back up from the shower plug hule with dirty bits in it. Yuk!!
reviews.title: Not good, very dated and shabby!

reviews.text: When we arrivd they couldnt find one of our bookings, it was found after a 10 min call to the UK (on my mobile as they said their phones didnt work?!).
reviews.title: THE BEST HOTEL FOR DISNEY LAND VACATION

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed in the Campanile just up the road, a much much better hotel! I would never stay here again.
reviews.title: Pretty good and close to Disneyland Paris

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and found this to be an excellent base for Disneyland Paris. The hotel off junction 11 of the E4 motorway east of Paris is straightforward to find and has plenty of available parking. The staff at reception are very friendly and speak good english. The family room we had was fine, although it was rather hot (outside temperature was 35 degrees). The room was clean and was just what you expect from somewhere to sleep. It was quiet and we were not disturbed by any other residents. The buffet breakfast was excellent - lots of choice, not busy and was always well stocked. All you could ask for. A great job by the staff. Disneyland is about 15 mins drive away. If leaving the hotel, turn left at the first traffic lights and follow the road round. Turn right at the next roundabout then follow the A4 and then left at the next roundabout. This will bring you on at the next junction of the A4 going eastbound. Reverse these directions for coming back.
reviews.title: Ideal base for Disneyland Paris

reviews.text: My Husband and I and two daughters (12 and 7) stayed here for two nights as a stopgap as we had rented an apartment in nearby Chessy and wanted to benefit from a couple of extra days.
reviews.title: Great Breakfast and Great for Disney

reviews.text: We booked through expedia, exeptional value and quick check in with friendly professional staff.
reviews.title: Great for Family going to Disneyland

reviews.text: Our room was clean and there was enough room for the four of us for a couple of days - think we may have struggled for any longer though... The fridge was a god send, we quickly filled it up with water. drinks and snacks from a nearby local supermarket. (Tip - don't buy drinks and snacks from the hotel as with all hotels = extortionate!
reviews.title: A great base for doing Disney

reviews.text: The hotel is fine. Rooms are ok (although could do with a bit more of a clean) and quiet. We had to ask for a travel cot 3 times but one was provided in the end and that was ok as well. The hotel itself is a good base for Disneyland, Paris as it's only 15 minutes away (2 junctions) and so good value from that perspective. We didn't use the swimming pool but it looked very small. One thing to watch out for is when you return at night they have lifting barriers in the area to restrict the height of vehicles and so don't do what we did which was think we were going completely the wrong way!. It is the right way so go up to the barriers! Breakfast was ok, nothing special but children do eat free.
reviews.title: Nothing special but close to Disneyland, Paris

reviews.text: Stayed 2 nights for business trip. Friendly and helpfull staff on reception. The room was clean, spacious and it was quiet, so I was not disturbed by any other residents. The buffet breakfast was excellent. Delicious menu in restaurant. Clean pool, but it was freezing :) I would definately recommend to anyone.
reviews.title: Close to Paris and Disneyland

reviews.text: Really good value for Money.Only a short stay from Disneyland Paris this hotel has everything that you will need to ensure that you have an enjoyable stay.Location is great,breakfast was more than acceptable,the staff were very friendly and the kids enjoyed the free games in the hotel reception.Mcdonalds not a million miles away and the Pizzeria around the corner has good food and friendly service.I would recommend this hotel with hesitation.
reviews.title: Short Stay
Good hotel if you have a car
reviews.text: Nice modern hotel, good rooms, breakfast was v good with plenty of choice, nice gym, some nice touches for the kids e.g. xboxes, iMac's in lobby, and the staff are pleasant and helpful. Free wi-fi in rooms was cool too.

Disney & Val D Europe (for Auchan etc) are 10-15mins drive away on the motorway. There is a large Carrefour & some other hyper-stores about 5 mins drive away through Collegien town, near Torcy RER, which as others have mentioned you can use to get into Paris central quite easily.
reviews.title: Good base for Paris and Disney

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pizza place just up the road from the hotel (walking distance) is very good and reasonably priced, we ate there a couple of evenings.
reviews.title: Room not clean

reviews.text: We stayed 4 nights b&b for £300 (Expedia via Quidco) which is pretty good value for a 4* compared to many of the other hotels in the area. Would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Great base for Disney

aka: Novotel Marne La Vallee Collegien Hotel
description: The Novotel Marne La Vallee Collegien is the closest hotel to Disneyland Paris, just 10 minutes away. This 3 star hotel, located 30 km from Roissy Charles de Gaulle Airport with a direct RER train connection to Paris, is perfect for combining a businesstrip with relaxation activities. The hotel offers 197 airconditioned rooms, meeting rooms for up to 500 people, a swimming pool and a garden where you can enjoy a meal on the terrace. Restaurant open until 10.30 p.m. Secure outdoor parking.
